column4: anybody know if there is something like ActiveSyn for linux ? so I can sync my smartphone
gnome-pilot-Applet i use it for my palmdevice
My smarthone is running Windows Mobile. Do you think this will work with gnome-pilot-Applet?
@xukum yes it is designed for any handhelddevice
thanks. I will try
you will need sync your smartphone with evolution (note that)
I connected the smarthpone with the usb cabel on my laptop. What is the first thing that I need to do?
start gnome-pilot-Applet?
you have to test where the device is connect (on which port)
btw don't make it so difficult in most cases it is /dev/USB0 or /dev/USB1
How do I see which usb port its connected?
How can I see which usb port my smartphone is connected to?
do you speak german
it's quite a lot of stuff and i only found a german hwto
whatever you will need following packages: multisync libmultisync-plugin-evolution synce-multisync-plugin
install all the packages wit apt-get (i hope you already have a working kernel for this usecase)
find out on which serial port your smartphone is with the command: pilot-link
u will need the package pilot-link
just wirte the adress pilot-link gives you in your configuration and everything is fine ;)
i found it at http://www.galileocomputing.de/openbook/ubuntu/ubuntu_4_007.htm if u speak german u will be fine with this howto
